message.content:
cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.SP, cs.NA, cs.SI. 

The paper proposes a new algorithm for recovery of sparse signals from compressively sensed samples, which falls under the category of signal processing (cs.SP). The algorithm uses a weighted exponential function to decompose each sample of the signal into two variables, which are updated using gradient descent method. The first variable is used to solve the Lasso problem, which falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG) and optimization (cs.NA). The second variable participates in the regularization term of the Lasso, which gradually detects the non-zero elements, and enables the extension of the corresponding vector to matrix form, which falls under the category of linear algebra (cs.SI). The paper also discusses the use of correlation matrix for a heuristic search, which falls under the category of information theory (cs.IT). Therefore, the likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.SP, cs.NA, and cs.SI, ordered from most to least likely.
